profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 00:00

did.abstract: Published and unpublished music and other materials by and about the American composer Elliot Griffis (1893-1967)

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Griffis's compositions are open to researchers by appointment. There are no restricted materials in the collection. Please contact the Special Collections staff to schedule an appointment.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was established in the Music Library of Yale University by Ellsworth Grumman, Roland Tiemann, and Luther Noss.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The collection is the physical property of the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University. Copyrights belong to the composers and authors, or their legal heirs and assigns.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Misc. Ms. 53, Selected Compositions of Elliot Griffis in the Irving S. Gilmore Music Library of Yale University.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: In 2 series as follows: I. Music. II. Miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of published piano music, songs, and the violin sonata by Elliot Griffis. The collection also holds a holograph score of the composer's Intrata for piano, as well as photocopies of holograph scores for 7 other compositions. The last folder of the collection contains a small amount of biographical material, including portraits, programs, and reviews.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Elliot Griffis was born on January 28, 1893 in Boston. He was educated at Ithaca College, the Yale School of Music (where he studied with Horatio Parker), and the New England Conservatory. He taught at numerous schools and performed widely as a pianist, before moving to Los Angeles to compose film music. He died there on June 8, 1967.
